definition: Wang Ching-wei (1883-1944), left-wing Guomingdang politician, subsequently Japanese collaborator
expanse of water/ooze/(onom.) bark/classifier for liquids: pool, puddle
surname Wang
essence/extract/vitality/energy/semen/sperm/mythical goblin spirit/highly perfected/elite/the pick of sth/proficient (refined ability)/extremely (fine)/selected rice (archaic)
surname Wei/vassal state during the Zhou Dynasty (1066-221 BC), located in present day Henan and Hebei Provinces
to guard/to protect/to defend/abbr. for 衛生|卫生, hygiene/health/abbr. for 衛生間|卫生间, toilet

sentences.english: Wang Jingwei's political thought was complex and changeful all his life.
sentences.chinese: 汪精衛一生的政治思想複雜而多變。

sentences.english: Subordinates are not optimistic about Wang Jingwei to sign the agreement.
sentences.chinese: 下屬不看好汪精衛要籤的協議。

sentences.english: Wang Jingwei put forward his own political view.
sentences.chinese: 汪精衛據此提出自己的政治主張。

sentences.english: Wang himself died of cancer in 1944.
Xue know Wang Jingwei sent the crown of the news.
sentences.chinese: 薛釵知道了汪精衛送皇冠的消息。

sentences.english: Wang Ching-wei was the head of the pro-Japanese group in the Kuomintang.
sentences.chinese: 汪精衛是當時國民黨中親日派的首領。

definition: Chiang Kai-shek (1887-1975), military leader, head of the Nationalist government in China 1928-1949 and the government in exile on Taiwan 1950-1975
Dr Sun Yat-sen (1866-1925), first president of the Republic of China and co-founder of the Guomintang 國民黨|国民党/same as 孫逸仙|孙逸仙
Zhang Shizhao (1881-1973), revolutionary journalist in Shanghai, then established writer

Nationalist government 1920s-1949 under Chiang Kai-shek 蔣介石|蒋介石
He Yingqin (1890-1987), senior Guomindang general
Zhang Zhizhong (1890-1969), National Revolutionary Army general

Yuan Shikai (1859-1916), senior general of late Qing, subsequently warlord and self-proclaimed emperor of China
Chen Yi (1901-1972), communist general and politician, Marshal of PLA from 1955, Mayor of Shanghai in 1950s, PRC foreign minister 1958-1972
Yu Dafu (1896-1945), poet and novelist
Zhang Zuolin (c. 1873-1928), warlord of Manchuria 1916-1928

Xiao Hong (1911-1942), prominent woman writer, originally from Heilongjiang
Liu Shaoqi (1898-1969), Chinese communist leader, a martyr of the Cultural Revolution
